abstracts.cdata!:
Project ratings are as follows: Project
            outcome is satisfactory; sustainability is likely;
            institutional development impact is substantial; Bank
            performance is satisfactory; and Borrower performance is
            satisfactory. Lessons cited included: Decentralizing control
            in a research organization increases efficiency providing it
            is accompanied by systems of accountability. Organizational
            and management changes should be introduced with a clear
            communication strategy and guidelines for their
            implementation. For public-private partnerships to flourish
            in research and development, an enabling environment,
            private sector participation in project design and
            implementation, and broad dissemination of success stories,
            are important. Linkages between research and extension need
            to be strengthened and flexibly linked with private sector
            marketing networks. Research impact can be accelerated by
            consolidating participatory research skills and focusing
            more resources on training of researchers and extension
            workers.  Monitoring and evaluation, and impact assessment
            is best outsourced to external agencies, and project design
            should focus more on reflection and impact assessment than
            action. Regarding flexibility and accountability in
            extension funding, one key factor that contributed directly
            to the success of the ATMA model was to shift
            decision-making responsibility for program planning to those
            people who were responsible for program delivery.
            Convergence of line departments is needed to increase the
            cost-effectiveness of extension. A fundamental limitation in
            the current extension system is the distribution of free
            inputs and services to farmers. This creates a dependency
            relationship on government and many farmers look to
            extension for a "hand-out" rather than as a
            reliable source of technology and information.
